title: Ticket #5762: Collector asserts if NO_DNS = True when updating developers collector
description:
If config knob NO_DNS = True, the condor_collector process will exit with an error several times per hour, asserting when sending an update to the developer collector with the following error message in the CollectorLog : 

   ERROR "Unknown protocol (1) in Sock::bind(); aborting." at line 741 in file /home/tannenba/condor/CONDOR_SRC/src/condor_io/sock.cpp

The patch fixes the underlying problem, which is a failure to check for errors when converting a no-dns hostname to an ip sockaddr. Because "condor.cs.wisc.edu" does not have the usual format for a "no-dns" hostname where the address is included in the host, the sockaddr is not created, and bind then asserts.

A work-around for versions for earlier versions of v8.4 is to put the following into condor_config: 

   CONDOR_DEVELOPERS_COLLECTOR = NONE

Thread in htcondor-users is here.
